see photo 1 below take a scrap of blue yarn that has been folded in half and pull up a loop photo 2 yarn over with both strands of blue yarn photo 3 and pull them all the way through photos 4 and 5 this blue st marker is where you will attach the 3 wedge lids later on now continuing round 8 single_crochet in the remaining 12 st s of round 7 chain 1 and turn 15 1 2 3 4 5 9 single_crochet increase in the first st now add a white st marker in the last st of round 8 in the same way as before single_crochet in the next 4 st s *single_crochet increase 4 x single_crochet* x 2 chain 1 and turn 18 10 18 x single_crochet chain 1 and turn 18 11 *single_crochet increase 5 x single_crochet* x 3 chain 1 and turn 21 12 21 x single_crochet chain 1 and turn 21 white st marker at the end 13 *single_crochet increase 6 x single_crochet* x 3 chain 1 and turn 24 of round 8 14 24 x single_crochet join to the first single_crochet of the round with a slip_stitch do not turn 24 15 please note i advise you to use a scrap of yellow yarn as a st marker to mark the first st of this round and subsequent rounds to do this simply lay the scrap of yellow yarn over your work after the initial chain-1 and then work over it in subsequent rounds flick it back and forth over your work after each initial chain-1 and work over it this forms what is called a running st marker chain 1 24 x single_crochet do not make your first st in the same st as the slip_stitch join your last st should fall in the back end of the slip_stitch join which is quite tight join to the first single_crochet with a slip_stitch 24 now you are going to add the mouth yellow running st marker 4 16 chain 1 place the mouth inside the head with the right side pointing away from you insert your hook into the next st of the head and any
